result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mohamad Shafi-Bin Zakaria

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mohamad Shafi-Bin Zakaria in court.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic in court for Mohamad Shafi-Bin Zakaria.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn Rohinga Interpreter: Rezza Uddin.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 12-5-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RBM.

Defendant Mohamad Shafi-Bin Zakaria in court. Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sworn as interpreter: Shaukhat Ali
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 10 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mohamad Shafi-Bin Zakaria in court.  Attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears in court in need of Rohinga Interpreter.  No interpreter available. Case is adjourned for Initial Appearance when interpreter will be available.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 10/10/22 @ 1p
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
